subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Culture Fit vs. Culture Add
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Culture Fit vs. Culture Add.

hook.text: A startup hires only people who 'feel like us.' Two years later, the whole team thinks identicallyâ€”and can't innovate.

buildup.text: Culture fit was the hiring mantra of the 2010s. But it became code for 'looks and thinks like me.'

discovery.text: Culture add flips the question: what's missing from our team that this person brings?

twist.text: Research shows diverse teams outperform homogeneous ones on complex problems by up to 35%.

climax.text: Pandora replaced 'culture fit' interviews with structured questions that reduced bias and improved retention.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between 'culture fit' and 'culture add'?
options: Culture fit focuses on similarity; culture add focuses on what's missing
Culture fit is for startups; culture add is for large companies
Culture add requires more interviews than culture fit
